site_name: Foster Hall St Barnabas Road, Walthamstow, London, E17 8QX
description: Proposals for internal alterations within Forest Hall, a Grade II listed building part of St Barnabas Parish complex, designed by Car√∂e architect and built in 1902; the current proposal is sited in the later addition- the extension - which was not as the architect intended. In order to create adequate 'Baby-class' facilities for the Early Education Centre, the works proposed consist of two elements: 1)Erection of an internal timber partition in the former office and in the kitchen room - in timber stud and birch plywood - construction details aim to minimize point of contact with existing elements. 2) Creation of a new opening in the existing wall between
